results.title: Taps and toilets
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Waterworks”.
Episode 4, ‘Taps and toilets’, deals with how human usage plays a role in the water cycle. Areas of human usage (both industrial and domestic) are discussed from the source point to the processes used for the purification of waste-water. Increased demand for water has highlighted long-standing problems with water supply including pollution. Forms of pollution discussed are tree clearing, salination and rainwater (carrying pesticides etc to our bays). Also discussed are unconfined aquifers (which explains our Billabongs), and confined aquifers like the Artesian Basin. Narrated by writer and producer Dick Beilby, this program creates relationships between our use of water and broader climatic environment beyond the taps and toilets - “the part of the water cycle that mostly connect with our lives”.

results.title: Tapping Canada's resources
results.brief_description: News magazine items: 1. In the Salt Mines: At Ojibway, Ontario, a journey to glittering white caverns is shown. 2. Trans-Canada Pipeline: The toughest stretch of the world’s longest gas pipeline—northern Ontario—is viewed. 3. Plywood for the World: At the largest plywood mill on Canada’s west coast, strips of veneer are peeled and then glued to form plywood.

results.title: Taperturning
results.creator_credit: K. Baron Hartley and Brent Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lathework series”.
Three methods of taper turning are demonstrated and explained. 1. Offset tailstock. 2. Adjustment of compound slide. 3. Taper turning attachment.

results.title: Tapeheads
results.creator_credit: Bill Fishman, Peter McCarthy, Pacific Arts, National Broadcasting Company, Front Films and De Laurentiis Entertainment Group
results.brief_description: A satire on the music business, “Tapeheads” is about two childhood friends who, after losing their jobs as security guards decide to scam their way into the music video industry. Ivan (John Cusack) is the exuberant friend who is accustomed to getting the more reserved Josh (Tim Robbins) into trouble. Forming Video Aces, Ivan encourages Josh to develop his creativity whilst the business-like Ivan helms the operation. Initially the pair work on a hilarious rapping commercial for a chicken and waffle outlet and a dying man’s video-will. Whilst doing the thankless rounds of the production companies, Ivan meets music impresario Mo Fuzz, and after hiring them (on spec) they embark upon their first successful rock music video. From there the irrepressible duo encounter all manner of swindles and mishaps on a twisted route to success. This film tapped into the cultural moment that was the origins of the MTV generation with a fast paced script and rapid editing, but perhaps the filmmakers were ahead of their time because despite its infectious and irreverent humour “Tapeheads” was a box-office failure. Cameos includes Weird Al Yankovich, Ted Nugent, Jello Biafra, Junior Walker and Sam Moore.

results.title: Tape
results.creator_credit: Richard Linklater, Alexis Alexanian, Gary Winick, Anne Walker-McBay, Independent Film Channel and InDigEnt (US)
results.brief_description: Set in a dull Michigan motel room, based on a one-act play, comes Richard Linklater’s “Tape” shot digitally and edited using Final Cut software. Two high school friends Vince (Ethan Hawke) and John (Robert Sean-Leonard) re-unite as twenty-something adults to reminisce. Memory and real events are questioned with the arrival of Amy (Uma Thurman) who claims she was date-raped by both of them. Tense and gripping with wonderful performances from the three leads. Based on the stage play by Stephen Belber.

results.title: Tapdancin'
results.brief_description: Tap Dancin’ explores the survivors and revivers of the great days of tap dance through performance, interviews and vintage footage which includes the Hoofers, the Copasetics and Bill “Bojangles” Robinson.

results.title: Tao: the way and its power
results.brief_description: Taoism lies at the root of almost all traditional Chinese art, thought and worship. This film, shot in Taiwan, Hong Kong, with footage from mainland China, seeks to show the importance and relevance of Taoism to today.

results.title: Tanzania: path for a nation
results.creator_credit: Ben Park, Gilbert Lauzun and United Nations Television
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “International zone”
President of Tanzania, Julius Nyerere, the guide in this film, explains his country’s determination to seek a single citizenship for all its people, to overcome problems of hunger, poverty and ignorance without putting the country in debt to outside exploiters, and to build new systems of cooperation at all levels.

results.title: Tanzania: of people and a vision
results.creator_credit: Donald J. Casey and Carousel Films
results.brief_description: In 1961, freedom bells rang for independence for the Tanzanian people and the country faced great developmental problems. President Nyerere sought to unite the people to work together as a nation. With government approval, Mary Knoll Missioners established an experimental village project that became a model for a new, communal lifestyle. Whereas in the past isolation was the common denominator, the people are now experiencing their first glimpse of “ujamaa”, African socialism or familyhood. Together, husbands and wives study agriculture, nutrition, animal husbandry, baby care; families help each other manufacture bricks and build homes.
